column1: Although  the  charges  have  been  framed  on  the  basis  of  two  acts  of  kissing  of
the genital area, I am unable to agree that the victim’s evidence that kissing of
her genital area by  the appellant happened only once and  her failure to come
up with what she has stated to the police in her statement in detail when giving
evidence, as matters that affects the credibility of her version of events.
When  considering  the  argument  that  it  was  strange  for  the  victim  to  not  to
inform  her  parents  of  the  sexual  abuse  suffered  by  her  even  if  there  was  a
death threat, that fact needs to be considered given her home environment that
prevailed  during  the  time  relevant  to  the  alleged  offences.  According  to  her
evidence,  her father was a person who was addicted to  liquor and the  mother
being  the  only  stable  income  earner  of  the  family  had  to  be  away  from  home
most of the day. The victim had been a child burdened with household chores
in  addition  to  her  studies,  including  looking  after  her  younger  sister.    It  is
obvious  that  the  victim  has  done  the  next  best  thing  after  the  sexual  abuses
suffered  by  her  became  unbearable  by  informing  her  grandmother  who  lived
away from their own home.
